standard_metadata.standard_description: Use decimal notation for fractions with denominators 10 or 100.

question.content: **Without using a calculator, convert the decimal to a simplified fraction.**  $0.2 = $

hints.content: $0.2=2\,\text{tenths}=\dfrac{2}{10}$  [[☃ image 1]]  A simplified fraction uses as large of pieces as possible. Can we make an equivalent fraction with larger pieces than tenths?

images.alt: A big square is divided into 10 equal vertical rectangles. Two rectangles from the left are shaded. The remaining 8 rectangles are not shaded.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  We can make an equivalent fraction using fifths.  [[☃ image 2]]  [[☃ explanation 1]]

images.alt: A big square is divided into 10 equal vertical rectangles. Two rectangles from the left are shaded. The remaining 8 rectangles are not shaded. Lines that divide the square into fifths are emphasized so that the shaded area makes up one-fifth of the square.
A big square is divided into 5 equal vertical rectangles. One rectangle from the left is shaded. The remaining 4 rectangles are not shaded.

question.content: **Without using a calculator, convert the decimal to a simplified fraction.**  $0.25 = $

hints.content: $0.25=25\,\text{hundredths}=\dfrac{25}{100}$  [[☃ image 1]]  A simplified fraction uses as large of pieces as possible. Can we make an equivalent fraction with larger pieces than hundredths?

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 rows of 10 squares each. In the bottom 5 rows, the left 5 squares are shaded.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  We can make an equivalent fraction using fourths.  [[☃ image 2]]  [[☃ explanation 1]]

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 rows of 10 squares each. In the bottom 5 rows, the left 5 squares are shaded. Lines that divide the square into fourths are emphasized so that the shaded area makes up one-fourth of the square.
A square made up of 4 equal-sized squares. The bottom left square is shaded.

question.content: **Without using a calculator, convert the decimal to a simplified fraction.**  $0.4 = $

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  $0.4=4\,\text{tenths}=\dfrac{4}{10}$   A simplified fraction uses as large of pieces as possible. Can we make an equivalent fraction with larger pieces than tenths?

images.alt: A big square is divided into 10 equal vertical rectangles. Four rectangles from the left are shaded. The remaining 6 rectangles are not shaded.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  We can make an equivalent fraction using fifths.   [[☃ image 2]]  [[☃ explanation 1]]

images.alt: A big square is divided into 10 equal vertical rectangles. Four rectangles from the left are shaded. The remaining 6 rectangles are not shaded .Lines that divide the square into fifths are emphasized so that the shaded area makes up two-fifths of the square.
A big square is divided into 5 equal vertical rectangles. Two rectangles from the left are shaded. The remaining 3 rectangles are not shaded.

question.content: **Without using a calculator, convert the decimal to a simplified fraction.**  $0.5 = $

hints.content: $0.5=5\,\text{tenths}=\dfrac{5}{10}$   [[☃ image 1]]  A simplified fraction uses as large of pieces as possible. Can we make an equivalent fraction with larger pieces than tenths?

images.alt: A big square is divided into 10 equal vertical rectangles. Five rectangles from the left are shaded. The remaining 5 rectangles are not shaded.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  We can make an equivalent fraction using halves.   [[☃ image 2]]  [[☃ explanation 2]]

images.alt: A big square is divided into 10 equal vertical rectangles. Five rectangles from the left are shaded. The remaining 5 rectangles are not shaded. A line that divides the square into halves is emphasized so that the shaded area makes up one-half of the square.
A big square is divided into 2 equal vertical rectangles. The rectangle on the left is shaded. The rectangle on the right is not shaded.

question.content: **Without using a calculator, convert the decimal to a simplified fraction.**  $0.6 = $

hints.content: $0.6=6\,\text{tenths}=\dfrac{6}{10}$    [[☃ image 1]]  A simplified fraction uses as large of pieces as possible. Can we make an equivalent fraction with larger pieces than tenths?

images.alt: A big square is divided into 10 equal vertical rectangles. Six rectangles from the left are shaded. The remaining 4 rectangles are not shaded.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  We can make an equivalent fraction using fifths.    [[☃ image 2]]  [[☃ explanation 1]]

images.alt: A big square is divided into 10 equal vertical rectangles. Six rectangles from the left are shaded. The remaining 4 rectangles are not shaded. Lines that divide the square into fifths are emphasized so that the shaded area makes up three-fifths of the square.
A big square is divided into 5 equal vertical rectangles. Three rectangles from the left are shaded. The remaining 2 rectangles are not shaded.

question.content: **Without using a calculator, convert the decimal to a simplified fraction.**  $0.75 = $

hints.content: $0.75=75\,\text{hundredths}=\dfrac{75}{100}$    [[☃ image 1]]  A simplified fraction uses as large of pieces as possible. Can we make an equivalent fraction with larger pieces than hundredths?

images.alt: A big square divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 rows of 10 squares each. In the bottom 5 rows, all 10 squares are shaded. In the remaining five rows, the left 5 squares are shaded.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  We can make an equivalent fraction using fourths.  [[☃ image 2]]  [[☃ explanation 1]]

images.alt: A big square divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 rows of 10 squares each. In the bottom 5 rows, all 10 squares are shaded. In the remaining five rows, the left 5 squares are shaded. Lines that divide the square into fourths are emphasized so that the shaded area makes up three-fourths of the square.
A square made up of 4 equal-sized squares. The top left square, the bottom left square, and the bottom right square are shaded.

question.content: **Without using a calculator, convert the decimal to a simplified fraction.**  $0.8 = $

hints.content: $0.8=8\,\text{tenths}=\dfrac{8}{10}$   [[☃ image 1]]  A simplified fraction uses as large of pieces as possible. Can we make an equivalent fraction with larger pieces than tenths?

images.alt: A big square is divided into 10 equal vertical rectangles. Eight rectangles from the left are shaded. The remaining 2 rectangles are not shaded.

hints.content: [[☃ image 1]]  We can make an equivalent fraction using fifths.    [[☃ image 2]]  [[☃ explanation 1]]

images.alt: A big square is divided into 10 equal vertical rectangles. Eight rectangles from the left are shaded. The remaining 2 rectangles are not shaded. Lines that divide the square into fifths are emphasized so that the shaded area makes up four-fifths of the square.
A big square is divided into 5 equal vertical rectangles. Four rectangles from the left are shaded. The remaining 1 rectangle is not shaded.
